title: Israel Says 3 Senior Hamas Leaders Killed In Gaza Attack
content: The Israeli military has said it had killed three senior Hamas militants in strikes on a designated safe zone in southern Gaza.
summary: The Israeli military has said it had killed three senior Hamas militants in strikes on a designated safe zone in southern Gaza.

title: Biden Says "Working" On Lifting Ban On Long-Range Missiles For Ukraine
content: President Joe Biden said Tuesday he was "working" on the possibility of authorizing Ukraine to use long-range, US-made missiles against Russia, after Western powers said Iran was delivering missiles to Moscow.
summary: President Joe Biden said Tuesday he was "working" on the possibility of authorizing Ukraine to use long-range, US-made missiles against Russia, after Western powers said Iran was delivering missiles to Moscow.

title: Pak Man Accused Of Plotting Attack On US Jews Was On Student Visa In Canada
content: A Pakistani man accused of plotting to attack a New York City Jewish center in support of Islamic State was in Canada on a student visa, Canada's immigration minister said on Tuesday.
summary: A Pakistani man accused of plotting to attack a New York City Jewish center in support of Islamic State was in Canada on a student visa, Canada's immigration minister said on Tuesday.

title: Trump, Harris Face-Off In Crucial Presidential Debate Ahead Of US Elections
content: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris will participate in the crucial US Presidential debate being hosted by ABC Networks globally. The presidential debate comes exactly 8 weeks ahead of election day across the United States.
summary: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris will participate in the crucial US Presidential debate being hosted by ABC Networks globally. The presidential debate comes exactly 8 weeks ahead of election day across the United States.

title: SpiceJet Says Carlyle Aviation Will Write Off $40 Million Of Lease Arrears
content: SpiceJet said on Tuesday that Carlyle Group's commercial aviation investment and servicing unit will write off $40.2 million of the airline's lease arrears and convert $30 million of its arrears into equity.
summary: SpiceJet said on Tuesday that Carlyle Group's commercial aviation investment and servicing unit will write off $40.2 million of the airline's lease arrears and convert $30 million of its arrears into equity.

title: Trump's Insults Of Harris In Debate Carry Big Risks - For Both Candidates
content: Tuesday's nationally televised debate, the first face-to-face meeting between Trump and his Democratic rival, Vice President Kamala Harris, could be a critical juncture in a race that is essentially tied eight weeks before the November 5 election.
summary: Tuesday's nationally televised debate, the first face-to-face meeting between Trump and his Democratic rival, Vice President Kamala Harris, could be a critical juncture in a race that is essentially tied eight weeks before the November 5 election.

title: India To Get Major Investment For Semiconductors From Israel: Envoy
content: Israel is planning a major investment in India in the semiconductor sector, its envoy said today, calling the development a "big news".
summary: Israel is planning a major investment in India in the semiconductor sector, its envoy said today, calling the development a "big news".

title: Frenchman On Trial For Mass Rape Of Wife Hospitalised
content: A Frenchman being tried for recruiting strangers to rape his drugged wife will be back in court to testify on Wednesday after being admitted to hospital, the presiding judge at his trial said.
summary: A Frenchman being tried for recruiting strangers to rape his drugged wife will be back in court to testify on Wednesday after being admitted to hospital, the presiding judge at his trial said.

title: "Reconsider Travel To Pakistan Due To Terror": US Updates Travel Advisory
content: Revising its travel advisory for Pakistan, the United States has advised its citizens to reconsider travelling to the country citing a threat of terrorism.
summary: Revising its travel advisory for Pakistan, the United States has advised its citizens to reconsider travelling to the country citing a threat of terrorism.

title: "Not Acceptable": Blinken After American Woman Shot In Head By Israel
content: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Tuesday demanded an overhaul of Israeli military conduct in the occupied West Bank as he decried the fatal shooting of an American protester against settlement expansion, which Israel said was accidental.
summary: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Tuesday demanded an overhaul of Israeli military conduct in the occupied West Bank as he decried the fatal shooting of an American protester against settlement expansion, which Israel said was accidental.

title: Western Powers Sanction Iran For Supplying Missiles To Russia
content: Western powers on Tuesday announced fresh sanctions on Iran for supplying Russia with short-range missiles for imminent use against Ukraine, calling it a dangerous escalation of the conflict that threatened European security.
summary: Western powers on Tuesday announced fresh sanctions on Iran for supplying Russia with short-range missiles for imminent use against Ukraine, calling it a dangerous escalation of the conflict that threatened European security.

title: Despite Political Risks, Justin Trudeau Could Remain Canada's PM Into 2025
content: Justin Trudeau may survive as Canada's prime minister into next year, political analysts say, even though his minority Liberal government is more vulnerable after a small left-wing party withdrew a pledge to support it on key votes.
summary: Justin Trudeau may survive as Canada's prime minister into next year, political analysts say, even though his minority Liberal government is more vulnerable after a small left-wing party withdrew a pledge to support it on key votes.

title: Harvey Weinstein "Out Of Danger" After Emergency Heart Surgery
content: Disgraced film producer Harvey Weinstein, 72, was recovering and "out of danger" Tuesday following emergency heart surgery, a representative told AFP.
summary: Disgraced film producer Harvey Weinstein, 72, was recovering and "out of danger" Tuesday following emergency heart surgery, a representative told AFP.

title: UK Says Terminating All Direct Air Services To Iran
content: The UK said Tuesday it has started terminating "all direct air services between the UK and Iran" as part of new sanctions on Tehran for supplying Russia with missiles to use in Ukraine.
summary: The UK said Tuesday it has started terminating "all direct air services between the UK and Iran" as part of new sanctions on Tehran for supplying Russia with missiles to use in Ukraine.

title: Italian Minister's Ex-Lover Banned From Parliament Over Spy Glasses
content: The woman at the centre of an affair that led to the resignation of Italy's culture minister was banned from parliament on Tuesday for allegedly illicitly filming inside the chamber using spy glasses.
summary: The woman at the centre of an affair that led to the resignation of Italy's culture minister was banned from parliament on Tuesday for allegedly illicitly filming inside the chamber using spy glasses.

title: S Jaishankar Meets German Counterpart, Discusses Ukraine, Gaza Conflicts
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar today held wide-ranging discussions with his German counterpart Annalena Baerbock and took stock of the India-Germany Strategic Partnership, covering areas such as trade, defence and security.
summary: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar today held wide-ranging discussions with his German counterpart Annalena Baerbock and took stock of the India-Germany Strategic Partnership, covering areas such as trade, defence and security.

title: "Groundbreaking": How People Reacted To Kate Middleton's Chemo Announcement
content: A slick video by Catherine, Princess of Wales announcing that her chemotherapy has finished marks a dramatic shift in communications for the British royal family, media and commentators said Tuesday.
summary: A slick video by Catherine, Princess of Wales announcing that her chemotherapy has finished marks a dramatic shift in communications for the British royal family, media and commentators said Tuesday.

title: Israel Strike On Lebanon Kills Hezbollah Commander: Report
content: An Israeli strike Tuesday on eastern Lebanon killed a Hezbollah commander, a source close to the group and the Israeli military said, with the Iran-backed movement saying it launched rockets in retaliation.
summary: An Israeli strike Tuesday on eastern Lebanon killed a Hezbollah commander, a source close to the group and the Israeli military said, with the Iran-backed movement saying it launched rockets in retaliation.

title: Imran Khan's Party Leaders Clash With Cops, Several Lawmakers Detained
content: Pakistani authorities arrested several leaders of jailed former prime minister Imran Khan's party, including its chairman and around a dozen lawmakers, as National Assembly Speaker Ayaz Sadiq on Tuesday promised action against those responsible for t
summary: Pakistani authorities arrested several leaders of jailed former prime minister Imran Khan's party, including its chairman and around a dozen lawmakers, as National Assembly Speaker Ayaz Sadiq on Tuesday promised action against those responsible for t

title: Amid Strained Ties, 2 Maldives Ministers Quit, President To Visit India
content: Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu will travel to India on an official visit "very soon", his spokesperson said today.
summary: Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu will travel to India on an official visit "very soon", his spokesperson said today.
